content: potomac view dyeworks adorable ankle socks materials main color at least 80g to knit sample as shown if knitting a regular size leg adjust accordingly contrast color approximately 20g needles size us 1 5 2 25mm pattern was knit using magic loop but is easily adapted to double points or two circulars yarn used sample was knit in blue moon socks that rock lightweight this is a very heavyweight sock yarn much closer to sport weight in my opinion so if you substitute and use a different sock yarn socks may turn out differently i would suggest to go down a needle size to make a more tight fitting sock with this weight yarn and if using a more conventional sock yarn e g lighter weight the sock will turn out smaller cast-on using a long-tail cast-on cast on 64 stitches on one circular needle slide 32 stitches to a second circular needle and join to work in the round by slipping the first stitch on one needle to the other and then switching the second stitch from that needle up and over the first stitch to the other needle this makes a nice join that won t loosen up ribbing p1 * k2 p2 repeat end with p1 knit 12 row leg work chart four times across needles and repeat chart for a total of three repeats short row heel note heel is worked on the 32 stitches on n1 attach contrasting color drop the main color but do not break complete short row heel as instructed below part 1 row 1 with rs facing knit one row until one stitch remains turn work row 2 with ws facing yo purl across until one stitch remains at this point it s a good idea to weave in and tighten up on the end of the contrast yarn since the last stitch will remain until the heel finishes it has a tendency to get really loose turn row 3 with rs facing yo and knit up to the k/yo over pair turn row 4 with ws facing yo and purl to the p/yo pair turn repeat row 3 and 4 until each needle has one stitch on the end 10 k/yo pairs this occurs after the ws row and you have turned and done the yo for the knit row in step 1 below short row heel cont part 2 1 on the rs yo and k to the first k/yo pair k1 1st stitch from the k/yo pair k2tog turn 2 on the ws yo and purl to the first p/yo pair p1 1st st from the p/yo pair p2 through the back loops turn 3 on the rs yo and knit to the first yo and k3tog the 2 yos and knit stitch from the next pair turn 4 on ws yo and purl to the first yo
